page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The village of Minster Lovell is steeped in history. The old Manor House is outside our area but the "new" part of the village, in which most people live has a history of its own. In the 1840's, a man called Fergus O'Connor bought some land and built a number of small cottages,each with 2 to 4 acres of land. This was a self-sufficiency idea to help many poor people from the midlands provide for themslves. There was also a political motive behind the scheme and it was partly this that prevented the project being a success. Many of the original houses remain and protection orders have been placed on them.
